newsitem.title: ITALY: ATHLETICS-JOHNSON SAYS RECORD MAY LAST LONG TIME.
newsitem.headline: ATHLETICS-JOHNSON SAYS RECORD MAY LAST LONG TIME.

text.p: Michael Johnson said on Wednesday that he believed his 200 metres world record could be broken but probably not before the 2000 Olympics in Sydney.
The American, who reduced his own world mark of 19.66 seconds to 19.32 at the Atlanta Games last month, added that he did not know of anyone currently likely to better it.
"Of course it's possible to improve it but I think it will be very, very difficult," he told a news conference before the Grand Prix athletics finals in Milan on Saturday.
"I think it could only happen in a competition like the Olympics, where there is an extra incentive."
